theme.Question: In which year were the first Winter Olympic Games held?
theme.Explanation: The first Winter Olympic Games were held in Chamonix, France, in 1924, featuring 258 athletes from 16 nations.

theme.Question: What is the official language of the Winter Olympic Games?
theme.Explanation: French is the official language of the Winter Olympics, as decreed by the International Olympic Committee (IOC).

theme.Question: Which country has hosted the Winter Olympic Games three times?
theme.Explanation: Italy has hosted the Winter Olympics in Cortina d'Ampezzo (1956), Turin (2006), and will host in Milan-Cortina (2026).

theme.Question: What ancient sport inspired the creation of the biathlon event?
theme.Explanation: The biathlon event was inspired by the military ski patrols who would hunt game in the snow on skis.

theme.Question: In which Winter Olympics was snowboarding added to the official program?
theme.Explanation: Snowboarding was added to the Winter Olympic program in Nagano, Japan, in 1998, for the first time.

theme.Question: What is the minimum age for Winter Olympic figure skaters?
theme.Explanation: The minimum age for Winter Olympic figure skaters to compete is set at 15 years old by the International Skating Union.

theme.Question: Which Winter Olympics was the first to feature the sport of curling?
theme.Explanation: The sport of curling made its debut in the first Winter Olympics in 1924 in Chamonix, France.

theme.Question: How many gold medals did British figure skater Jayne Torvill win at the Winter Olympics?
theme.Explanation: Jayne Torvill won a gold medal in ice dance with her partner Christopher Dean at the 1984 Sarajevo Winter Olympics.

theme.Question: What is the length of a standard ski jumping hill for the large hill event?
theme.Explanation: The standard length for a large hill in ski jumping is 125 meters, or 410 feet.

theme.Question: Which Winter Olympic Games witnessed the infamous 'Tanya Harding and Nancy Kerrigan' incident?
theme.Explanation: The scandal involving Tanya Harding and Nancy Kerrigan took place at the 1994 Winter Olympics in Lillehammer, Norway.

theme.Question: What is the diameter of the target in the biathlon shooting range?
theme.Explanation: In the biathlon, the diameter of the target for prone shooting is 45 millimeters, while for standing shooting it is 115mm.

theme.Question: Which Winter Olympics was the first to include the sport of freestyle skiing?
theme.Explanation: Freestyle skiing was added to the Winter Olympic program in 1992, in Albertville, France, as a demonstration sport.

theme.Question: What is the maximum speed recorded in skeleton racing events?
theme.Explanation: Skeleton racers can reach speeds of up to 130 km/h (81 mph) while hurtling headfirst down the ice track.

theme.Question: In which discipline did the legendary figure skater Sonja Henie win her Olympic gold medals?
theme.Explanation: Sonja Henie, a Norwegian figure skater, won three consecutive Olympic gold medals in ladies' singles in 1928, 1932, and 1936.

theme.Question: What is the weight of the standard Olympic bobsled for a four-person team?
theme.Explanation: The standard weight of an Olympic four-person bobsled is between 390 to 430 kilograms (860 to 950 pounds).

theme.Question: Which Winter Olympic Games were notably affected by the 'Miracle on Ice' ice hockey match?
theme.Explanation: The 'Miracle on Ice' happened in the 1980 Winter Olympics when the USA ice hockey team beat the heavily favored Soviet team.

theme.Question: What is the length of the standard track for the luge event?
theme.Explanation: The standard length for the luge track in the Winter Olympics is 1500 meters, or 4921 feet.

theme.Question: Which Winter Olympics was the first to have an official mascot?
theme.Explanation: The first official Winter Olympic mascot was 'Schuss' the skier, introduced in the 1968 Grenoble Winter Olympics.

theme.Question: What is the height of the regulation ice hockey goal net?
theme.Explanation: The regulation ice hockey goal net is 1.22 meters (4 feet) in height and 1.83 meters (6 feet) in width.

theme.Question: In which Winter Olympics did curling become an official medal sport?
theme.Explanation: Curling became an official medal sport in the 1998 Winter Olympics in Nagano, Japan, after being a demonstration sport in 1924 and 1932.
